transcriptText:
Indian clubs 101 | A step by step video guide to classic and modern exercises

This video course is designed with the new beginner in mind. Thierry takes you through the basics of club swinging. Full body and mind experience guaranteed!

Learn the key points and start swinging along with gentle and simple exercises that will build your confidence. You will experience flowing movements, and even get a short fun workout in by the end.

What can Indian clubs do for you?

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport | An ancient discipline

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

welcome to Indian clubs and how to use them this step-by-step video course is going to show you how to perform gradually more complex Swings with two engine clubs we're going to swing relatively light engine clubs in an open style which is based on the Bridge's style of Club swinging tradition I'm going to show you all the essential building blocks to increase your skills and coordination with Indian clubs from the basic pendulums to circles to the signature move of Indian clubs known as the heart shape swing you're going to experience being the state of flow and moving to the rhythm of the clubs aside from the tutorials we're going to cover some short flows or small routines and a short circuit training that you can repeat according to your Fitness levels the idea is to show you a simple way of how you can structure a training session on your own so review the safety guidelines and then let's get started

## Description

```
Indian clubs 101 | A step by step video guide to classic and modern exercises

This video course is designed with the new beginner in mind. Thierry takes you through the basics of club swinging. Full body and mind experience guaranteed!

Learn the key points and start swinging along with gentle and simple exercises that will build your confidence. You will experience flowing movements, and even get a short fun workout in by the end.

---
What can Indian clubs do for you?
Watch this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ft-FL_6s_No

❂ Physical benefits
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

❂ Mental benefits
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ Heroic Sport | An ancient discipline 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ range to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors and wrestlers. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.
```

## Transcript

welcome to Indian clubs and how to use them this step-by-step video course is going to show you how to perform gradually more complex Swings with two engine clubs we're going to swing relatively light engine clubs in an open style which is based on the Bridge's style of Club swinging tradition I'm going to show you all the essential building blocks to increase your skills and coordination with Indian clubs from the basic pendulums to circles to the signature move of Indian clubs known as the heart shape swing you're going to experience being the state of flow and moving to the rhythm of the clubs aside from the tutorials we're going to cover some short flows or small routines and a short circuit training that you can repeat according to your Fitness levels the idea is to show you a simple way of how you can structure a training session on your own so review the safety guidelines and then let's get started
